question_title: Will the community prediction be higher than 31.00% on 2026-02-15 for the Metaculus question "Will there be a ceasefire in the Sudanese Civil War during 2026?"?
summary: This meta-prediction asks whether the Metaculus CP for Sudan ceasefire will rise above exactly 31.00% by Feb 15. The CP has been stable at 31% for ~2 weeks despite ongoing news, supported by a large forecaster base (708) that creates inertia. Recent news is uniformly negative for ceasefire: SAF is making major military gains (broke Dilling siege, killed key RSF figure), Egypt is directly supporting SAF with drone strikes, RSF rejected the government's ceasefire proposal, and fighting is intensifying across Kordofan and Darfur. With SAF winning militarily, they have little incentive to negotiate. The only potential positive catalyst is the UN ministerial-level briefing in February, but this is unlikely to produce breakthrough news. Status quo favors CP staying at or below 31%.

factors.description: Large forecaster base (708) creates stability/inertia requiring significant news to move CP
CP has been stable at exactly 31% for ~2 weeks (Jan 19 to Feb 1) showing forecaster consensus is firm
SAF making significant military gains (broke Dilling siege, advances in Kordofan) - reduces their incentive to negotiate
RSF explicitly rejected government ceasefire proposal in December 2025
Egypt directly supporting SAF with drone strikes - escalation, not de-escalation
Exactly at threshold (31.00%) means any tiny upward movement matters - knife-edge sensitivity
UN ministerial-level briefing in February could generate positive headlines
Inherent uncertainty in predicting forecaster behavior over 11 days
